intro: Sida andersonii, commonly known as the Anderson's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, pale yellow to greenish flowers. It is typically found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Sida andersonii is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
